column2: Translator : Many companies require translators to help understand their communication with their counterparts. Jobs can be regular ,  full time or part - time. There are also many translation agencies which employ personnel having good knowledge of a foreign language. A person can work free - lance after gaining a few years experience. column2: Ensure target text correctly reflects the meaning of the source                   Perform linguistic tasks as per project instructions and other references (translation memory, glossary, style guides, etc)                   Ensure high-grammatical accuracy while maintaining key terminology, spotting inconsistencies and incorrect cultural references                   Correct formatting/tagging, punctuation, country specifics, terminology, style, fluency as per guidelines               Requirements                                 Degree in Translation, Applied Linguistics or equivalent experience                 Native speaker in Japanese language                  Excellent command of the English language in both comprehension and writing                 Preferred experience in translation and proofreading specialized in Fashion, E-Commerce field                 IT skills with knowledge and experience of CAT tools                  Comfortable with technology and open to learn to use new tools                 Linguistic and cultural competences of both source and target language                 Adaptive to fast-paced work environment with multiple changes of project priorities                 Ability to maintain professionalism under pressure and meet tight deadlines                 Problem solving and decision-making skills

column2: Indo-Fuji Information Technologies Pvt. Ltd is looking for Japanese Translator to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Japanese Translator, you will play a crucial role in facilitating communication between the company and its Japanese-speaking stakeholders      Your responsibilities include translating written content accurately, maintaining cultural nuances, and contributing to effective cross-cultural communication      This position requires linguistic expertise, cultural awareness, and the ability to collaborate with various teams        Responsibilities:        Translation:Translate a variety of documents, including business correspondence, reports, technical documents, and marketing materials from Japanese to the target language and vice versa      Ensure the accuracy, clarity, and cultural appropriateness of translations      Quality Assurance:Conduct thorough reviews and proofreading of translated content to maintain high linguistic and grammatical standards      Collaborate with other language professionals to ensure consistency      Cultural Sensitivity:Maintain a deep understanding of Japanese culture and customs      Adapt translations to capture cultural nuances and idioms appropriately      Communication:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, providing linguistic expertise and contributing to effective communication strategies      Clarify translation-related queries and provide linguistic insights      Terminology Management:Develop and maintain a consistent and accurate glossary of terms in both Japanese and the target language      Ensure adherence to industry-specific terminology      Deadline Management:Manage multiple translation projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and ensuring timely delivery      Communicate proactively with project managers and stakeholders regarding project timelines
column11: Translation, Manager Quality Assurance, Japanese Translator, Business correspondence, Management, Proof reading, Technical documentation
